text: Brenda Nokuzola Fassie (3 November 1964 – 9 May 2004) was a South African anti-apartheid Afropop singer.| Brenda Nokuzola Fassie | South African History Online| Remembering Brenda Fassie – 13 years on | IOL Entertainment == Early life == She was named after American singer Brenda Lee. Fassie's music became a symbol of hope for the South African black community during its Apartheid painful days.| Brenda Fassie immortalised in comic book | Brand South Africa == Death == Fassie died on 9 May 2004, aged 39.Brenda Fassie, 39, South African Pop Star, Dies - The New York Times == References == Category:1964 births Category:2004 deaths Category:South African singers Category:South African anti-apartheid activists Category:Bisexual people Category:LGBT singers Category:Drug-related deaths Category:People with HIV/AIDS Category:People from Cape Town
title: Brenda Fassie
